turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm trying to install a new kitchen faucet and I'm completely lost. Any advice?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Of course! I can definitely help with that. First, do you know what kind of faucet you have? Knowing whether it's a single-handle or two-handle faucet will help determine the installation process. Also, do you have the old faucet removed already?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, it's a single-handle faucet. And no, the old one is still there. The instructions are so confusing. What's the best way to disconnect the water supply lines? I'm worried about making a huge mess and flooding the kitchen!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Alright. Before you do anything, turn off the water supply valves under your sink. If you don't have shut-off valves, you will need to turn off the water at the main water supply, which could be in your basement or outside. Next, place a towel under the supply lines to catch any remaining water. Use an adjustable wrench to loosen the nuts connecting the supply lines to the old faucet. *Important Note*: The type of supply line connections (compression, push-fit, etc.) will affect how you disconnect them. If you could send me a picture of the existing connections, I can give you more specific advice. Finally, carefully disconnect the lines. You might encounter some residual water pressure, so be prepared for a little water spillage. Let me know if you need more help with the faucet removal, I can walk you through it.
